WorkItem.Description:
The title says all. I'm at a complete loss. I've been trying for days on end to correct this issue myself with my extremely limited PHP knowledge, but to no avail.

A month or so ago, PHPExcel worked without a hitch and loaded up and fetched values from an Excel 2007 spreadsheet I had, however, all of a sudden, I started to get this error, and it wouldn't correct itself. My website is hosted off of GoDaddy, and it's been on PHP 5.3.0 since the first day.

I tried going back to Square One and reinstalling PHPExcel from scratch and using some of its example pages from within the PHPExcel distributable, but they would yield the same error. Thus, it's not an issue on my part, but with PHPExcel itself.

I've done some PHP checks to make sure that the files exist and are accessible (including String.php), so I highly doubt it's due to missing files or incorrect file permissions (of which they're on 777 anyway).

If anybody could help me figure out why PHPExcel is doing this, I would so greatly appreciate it. If it helps to know, my site has WordPress and PrestaShop installed under their own unique subdirectories (PHPExcel is installed on the root, and the example pages are in a separate subdirectory as the installation states to do).

Google has yielded me _/very/_ limited results: one place said that it was due to PHP 5.3.0 itself, while another said that the Autoloader itself had inconsistency issues. I don't know what to think.
WorkItem.Summary: Fatal error: Class 'PHPExcel_Shared_String' not found in Autoloader.php on line 36

Comments.Message: Other possible causes besides file permissions are some other autoloader for some other library or application that is conflicting with the PHPExcel autoloader

Can anyone please reply to fix the issue?

I have provided 777 permission to all the files and folders of PHPExcel but still the same issue.

I am really tiered with this same problem

Please anyone help me
Have you checked if any of your other code is using an autoloader?
If you are running PHPExcel 1.8.0 with PHP < 5.3.0, then a bug was introduced in the autoloader code that would cause this error. It has been fixed in the latest develop branch code on github
